marketNews.title: TPMA Forms JV with KKGI, Potential Net Profit Addition ~7.6%
marketNews.content: Trans Power Marine ($TPMA) together with Resources Alam Indonesia ($KKGI) announced the establishment of a joint venture (JV) named PT Trans Bahtera Pioneer (TBP). TBP will operate in the field of shipping services for coal transportation and logistics in the East Kalimantan region, which in 2023 produced 210 million tons of coal, equivalent to ~30% of national production. One of TBP's clients will be PT Insani Bara Perkasa, which is a subsidiary of KKGI with a production of 5.3 million tons in 2023. The ownership of this JV consists of 50% KKGI and 50% TPMA with an initial capital of 51.5 billion rupiah, so each issuer will contribute 25.75 billion rupiah. The reporting of this JV's contribution in the financial statements of both issuers will use the equity method. In its development plan, TBP will make an investment of 200 billion rupiah for the purchase of 6 sets of used and new tugboats and barges in the first year (2025). This cooperation is expected to expand up to 20 sets in the coming years. The investment financing will consist of a minimum of 20% internal cash and the rest through bank loans. Previously, TPMA had also expanded through several JVs. In 2021, TPMA formed a JV named PT Trans Logistik Perkasa (TLP) with T&J Industrial Holding Limited (TJI) - a business entity of Tsingshan Holding Group - and Pacific Pelayaran Indonesia. In addition, in early September 2024, TPMA also established Trans Ocean Permata (TOP), which is a joint venture with PT Samudra Investama Maju. Key Takeaway: Based on our conservative estimation and management statements, TBP has the potential to provide an additional net profit of 2.5 million US dollars when it completes its entire fleet of 20 sets, equivalent to 7.6% of our FY25 estimated net profit for TPMA at the level of 32.4 million US dollars (before accounting for the net profit contribution from TBP). With 6 vessel sets in the first year, TBP has the potential to generate a net profit of 461 thousand US dollars, equivalent to 1.4% of our FY25 estimated net profit for TPMA. Some assumptions we use are: Addition of 6 vessels gradually, consisting of 2 vessels in 1Q25 and 4 vessels in 2Q-4Q25. We estimate TBP's revenue will be lower than TOP in 2025 due to the faster expected fleet delivery for TOP because it was formed earlier. Assumption of revenue per set of 1.1 billion rupiah per month (~683 thousand US dollars per month) for tugboat & barge, equivalent to TLP which has the lowest revenue per set compared to TPM and BEST, based on our calculation. Net profit margin assumption of 30%, equivalent to TOP.

marketNews.title: ACES: SSSG +9% YoY in 11M24, Exceeding Target
marketNews.content: ACES: Aspirasi Hidup Indonesia recorded same store sales growth (SSSG) of +6.0% YoY in November 2024 (vs. October 2024: +4.8% YoY, November 2023: +10% YoY). This result brought SSSG over 11M24 to +9.0% YoY (vs. 11M23: +7.6% YoY), above management's FY24 guidance at the +8% level. Areas outside Java (+7.9% YoY) were the region with the highest SSSG growth in November 2024, followed by Java outside Jakarta (+5.7% YoY) and Jakarta (+3.2% YoY). ACES opened 1 new store in Lampung in November 2024, bringing the total new stores in 11M24 to 16 stores.

marketNews.title: Government Planning Excise Socialization for Sweetened Packaged Beverages
marketNews.content: The Director of Revenue and Strategic Planning of the Directorate General of Customs and Excise, Ministry of Finance, Muhammad Aflah Farobi, stated that the government is planning to socialize the excise tax on sweetened packaged beverages (MBDK) to related companies. Aflah indicated that the implementation plan for the MBDK excise tax will be implemented soon because the government needs substantial revenue next year. For information, the revenue target from the MBDK excise tax is 3.8 trillion rupiah in 2025.

marketNews.title: Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources Proposing VAT Exemption for Oil and Gas Exploration
marketNews.content: The Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources, Bahlil Lahadalia, will propose to the Minister of Finance Sri Mulyani Indrawati that oil and gas (migas) exploration activities be exempted from Value Added Tax (PPN). This is because exploration activities do not necessarily guarantee oil and gas output. Therefore, a sweetener is needed to attract investor interest in investing domestically. According to Bahlil, instead of being paid upfront, the PPN is better paid afterwards, when the oil and gas results have been found.

marketNews.title: 26 State-Owned Enterprises Experience Director/Commissioner Changes So Far in 2024
marketNews.content: Kontan recorded that as of now, there have been 26 State-Owned Enterprises (BUMN) that have experienced changes in directors and commissioners. A source from Kontan revealed that there is a subsequent plan for a change, specifically for the position of Deputy President Director of PT PLN. A BUMN observer from Datanesia Institute, Herry Gunawan, said that 2024 set a record for the highest number of reshuffles of BUMN top management.

marketNews.title: Supreme Court Rejects Bankruptcy Cassation Appeal by Sritex
marketNews.content: The Supreme Court officially rejected the cassation appeal of Sri Rejeki Isman ($SRIL) or Sritex regarding the bankruptcy ruling filed by Indo Bharat Rayon on Wednesday (18/12). Sritex has decided to take legal action for a judicial review of the ruling.

marketNews.title: US Economic Analysis Bureau Revises Q3 GDP Growth Upwards
marketNews.content: The US economic analysis bureau revised up US third-quarter GDP growth to 3.1% YoY, based on the third estimate. This figure is an increase from 2.8% YoY in the second estimate and is higher than the consensus estimate which expected no change in the US economic growth level.

marketNews.title: US Congress Fails to Reach Spending Bill Agreement, Risk of Partial Shutdown Before Christmas
marketNews.content: The US Congress on Thursday (19/12) failed to reach an agreement on the US government budget bill. If the US parliament fails to find a solution to this agreement by Friday (20/12), the US government risks a partial shutdown which could disrupt US government activities heading into Christmas.

tickerNews.title: ACES Reports SSSG +6.0% YoY in November 2024, Lifting 11M24 SSSG to +9.0% YoY Beyond Guidance
tickerNews.content: ACES: Aspirasi Hidup Indonesia recorded same store sales growth (SSSG) of +6.0% YoY in November 2024 (vs. October 2024: +4.8% YoY, November 2023: +10% YoY). This result makes the SSSG during 11M24 reach +9.0% YoY (vs. 11M23: +7.6% YoY), above management's FY24 guidance at the +8% level. Areas outside Java (+7.9% YoY) became the region with the highest SSSG growth in November 2024, followed by Java outside Jakarta (+5.7% YoY) and Jakarta (+3.2% YoY). ACES itself opened 1 new store in Lampung in November 2024, resulting in a total of 16 new stores during 11M24.

tickerNews.title: Techno9 Indonesia (NINE) Announces plans for takeover acquisition by Singaporean coal and mining company Poh Group Pte. Ltd.
tickerNews.content: NINE: Techno9 Indonesia announced a plan for the takeover acquisition of the company by Poh Group Pte. Ltd, a Singapore-based coal and mining company. Poh Group Pte. Ltd plans to purchase ~70% of NINE shares owned by NINE's majority shareholders, Heddy Kandoi and Noproan Fadli, and several other minority shareholders of NINE. The final value and time of transaction completion are still under negotiation. After the completion of this transaction, Poh Group Pte. Ltd will become the new controller of NINE and will carry out a mandatory tender offer in accordance with applicable provisions.

tickerNews.title: Cahayaputra Asa Keramik (CAKK) President Director Sells Entire Stake
tickerNews.content: CAKK: Johan Silitonga, President Director of Cahayaputra Asa Keramik, sold all of his CAKK shares (amounting to 50.8 million shares, equivalent to 4.22% of shares) at a transaction price of 145 rupiah per share on December 19, 2024. The total transaction value reached ~7.4 billion rupiah.

tickerNews.title: Saratoga Investama Sedaya (SRTG) Reduces Stake in Provident Investasi Bersama (PALM) to 4.48% After Selling Shares
tickerNews.content: PALM: The shareholder of Provident Investasi Bersama, Saratoga Investama Sedaya ($SRTG), sold ~708 million PALM shares at a price of 350 rupiah per share on December 12 and 16, 2024. The total transaction value reached ~247 billion rupiah. After this transaction, SRTG's ownership in PALM decreased from 8.97% to 4.48%.

tickerNews.title: ICBP Confirms Exported Products Comply with Food Safety Regulations, Not Subject to Australian Recall
tickerNews.content: ICBP: Indofood CBP Sukses Makmur revealed that all products officially exported by the company abroad comply with applicable food safety requirements, regulations, and provisions. This statement is a response to the withdrawal of several Indomie product variants from circulation in Australia. The company also affirmed that the withdrawn products are not officially exported by the company. Furthermore, the company explained that all its instant noodle products officially exported to Australia can still be normally marketed and distributed by official distributors, without any withdrawal or detention of products by Australian authorities.

tickerNews.title: Mulia Boga Raya (KEJU) Shareholders Approve Bonus Share Plan with 4:11 Ratio Funded by Share Premium Capital
tickerNews.content: KEJU: Mulia Boga Raya shareholders approved the plan for a bonus share distribution with a 4:11 ratio from the share premium capitalization amounting to 206.3 billion rupiah as of December 31, 2023. The cum date in the regular and negotiation market is December 27, 2024, with distribution on January 17, 2025.

tickerNews.title: Sri Rejeki Isman (SRIL) or Sritex's Cassation Appeal Against Bankruptcy Ruling Rejected by Supreme Court; Company Plans Judicial Review
tickerNews.content: The Supreme Court officially rejected the cassation appeal of Sri Rejeki Isman ($SRIL) or Sritex regarding the bankruptcy ruling filed by Indo Bharat Rayon on Wednesday (18/12). Sritex has decided to file for a judicial review of the ruling.
